sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation commanding all deputie-lieutenants, and justices of peace, to attend those places in their proper counties: and that those that have houses and lands in the northern parts, shall resort thither, and reside there with their families. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
1 sheet ([1] p.).
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty: and by the assignes of John Bill, Imprinted at London : 1640.
Dated at end: ... Whitehall the fourteenth day of May, in the sixteenth yeer of Our reign. Arms 13; now dwellings punish-. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
